meanings.sent1: She reobjects the idea of staying up late.
meanings.sent2: He always reobjects when asked to do chores.
meanings.sent3: The cat reobjects taking a bath by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The tree reobjects the wind's attempt to bend its branches.
meanings.sent5: The child reobjects bedtime with a loud protest.

meanings.definition: To express strong disapproval or disagreement.
meanings.sent1: The teacher reobjects cheating on the test.
meanings.sent2: The committee reobjects the proposed budget cuts.
meanings.sent3: The dog reobjects the new dog food by refusing to eat it.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm reobjects the calm of the sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The audience reobjects loudly to the poor performance.

meanings.sent1: She reobjects at the unfair treatment of her friend.
meanings.sent2: He reobjects when he hears the rude comments.
meanings.sent3: The toddler reobjects at having to share his toys.
meanings.sent4: The lion reobjects the intrusion into its territory.
meanings.sent5: The student reobjects the low grade on the test.
